body: Define a matrix. Give an example of a $$2 \times 3$$ matrix.
If $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix}$$ and $$B = \begin{bmatrix} 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 \end{bmatrix}$$, find $$A + B$$.
Calculate the transpose of the matrix $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & -1 & 2 \\ 0 & 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix}$$.
Define a diagonal matrix and give an example of a $$3 \times 3$$ diagonal matrix.
If $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix}$$, find $$2A$$.
If $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \end{bmatrix}$$, find the order of the matrix.
Define a symmetric matrix. Give an example of a $$2 \times 2$$ symmetric matrix.
If $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 4 \\ 1 & 3 \end{bmatrix}$$ and $$B = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & 5 \\ 7 & 8 \end{bmatrix}$$, find $$A - B$$.
Define an identity matrix and provide an example of a $$3 \times 3$$ identity matrix.
Show that the matrix $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 3 & -1 \\ 4 & 2 \end{bmatrix}$$ is invertible by finding $$A^{-1}$$.
For the matrix $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix}$$, determine if $$A$$ is a scalar matrix.
Define a zero matrix. Provide an example of a $$2 \times 3$$ zero matrix.
If $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & -1 \\ 0 & 3 \end{bmatrix}$$, find $$A^2$$.
Explain the concept of equality of matrices.
Find the trace of the matrix $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix}$$.
If $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix}$$ and $$B = \begin{bmatrix} 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 \end{bmatrix}$$, find $$AB$$.
Determine whether the matrix $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 2 & 1 \end{bmatrix}$$ is symmetric.
Define a column matrix. Provide an example of a $$3 \times 1$$ column matrix.
If $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & -1 \end{bmatrix}$$, show that $$A^T = A$$.
Explain the distributive property of matrix addition.
If $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix}$$ and $$B = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & -1 \\ -2 & 0 \end{bmatrix}$$, verify that $$(A + B)^T = A^T + B^T$$.
Find the determinant of the matrix $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 1 & 4 \end{bmatrix}$$.
If $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix}$$, find $$A^{-1}$$.
Define a square matrix and provide an example of a $$2 \times 2$$ square matrix.
If $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 3 & 4 \\ 2 & 1 \end{bmatrix}$$ and $$B = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix}$$, find $$AB$$.
Explain why matrix multiplication is not commutative.
Determine if the matrix $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & -2 \\ -2 & 2 \end{bmatrix}$$ is symmetric or skew-symmetric.
If $$A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix}$$ and $$B = \begin{bmatrix} 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 \end{bmatrix}$$, find $$A - B$$.
Find the scalar multiplication $$3 \times \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix}$$.
